eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
description: This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.
An example shows how to change the 2 main colors of an object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://recolorizer)).
This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * Converts an HSL color value to RGB. Conversion formula
* Assumes h, s, and l are contained in the set [0, 1] and
* returns r, g, and b in the set [0, 255].
const q = l < 0.5 ? l * (1 + s) : l + s - l * s;
* Converts an RGB color value to HSL. Conversion formula
* Assumes r, g, and b are contained in the set [0, 255] and
* returns h, s, and l in the set [0, 1].
const max = Math.max(r, g, b), min = Math.min(r, g, b);
s = l > 0.5 ? d / (2 - max - min) : d / (max + min);
case r: h = (g - b) / d + (g < b ? 6 : 0); break;
case g: h = (b - r) / d + 2; break;
case b: h = (r - g) / d + 4; break;
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {{x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number}} frame
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
function recolorizeTexture(sourceCanvas, targetCanvas, frame, originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
// hue is not knowned for graycase colors.
// graycase pixels must take the targeted hue
pixelHsl[0] = pixelSaturation === 0 ? targetHue : gdjs.evtTools.common.mod(pixelHue - originHue + targetHue, 1);
// white pixels must also take the targeted saturation.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
function getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
* Manage recolorizations to ensure uniqueness of textures.
* Register a recolorization usage and get recolored textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
recolorizedSprite = { userCount: 0, textures: targetTextures, canvas: targetCanvas };
* Apply a recoloration to every textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
/** @type {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} */
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
this.recolorizationKey += getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope);
this.recolorizations.push({ originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope});
* Reset the default textures of the object.
* Update the textures of the object.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Loads a JSON resource into a variable.
description: Loads a (static) JSON resource from your project files into a global, scene, or object variable.
NEVER use this to load your game.json into a variable - this would increase your game size by a lot and make your whole project file available for anyone to open!

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * (1 - speed)

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * (1 - speed)^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln((1 - speed)))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

parameters: TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset + AngleDifference(CameraAngle(Object.Layer()), TargetedRotationAngle + 90 + RotationAngleOffset) * exp(TimeDelta() * RotationLogSpeed)

eventsFunctions.description: Start the recording.
eventsFunctions.name: Start

eventsFunctions.description: End the recording.
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

inlineCode: else gdjs._extensionRecord.setError('Stopping a recording that has not started');

eventsFunctions.description: Pause recording.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

inlineCode: else gdjs._extensionRecord.setError('Pausing a recording that has not started');

eventsFunctions.description: Resume recording.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

inlineCode: else gdjs._extensionRecord.setError('Resuming a recording that has not started');

eventsFunctions.description: Save recording to the file system on destop, or to the downloads folder for web. Always ask for permission to save a file.
eventsFunctions.name: Save

inlineCode: recorder.setError('Saving a recording that has not started');
recorder.setError('Saving a recording that has not stopped');
() => recorder.setError('Recording could not be saved to disk'),

parameters.description: File location, set using a FileSystem path e.g. FileSystem::DesktopPath() (only used for desktop saves)
parameters.name: path

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the current status of the reccorder: inactive (not recording), recording, or paused.
eventsFunctions.name: Status

eventsFunctions.description: Get the current framerate.
eventsFunctions.name: FrameRate

eventsFunctions.description: Set the frame rate, must be set before starting a recording. Defaults to the min FPS set in the game properties.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFrameRate

parameters.description: Recommended fps for video: 25, 30, 60, for GIFs use 5, 10, 20
parameters.name: fps

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the current video bit rate per second.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get video bit rate per second
eventsFunctions.name: VideoBitRate

eventsFunctions.description: Set the video bit rate, must be set before starting a recording. Defaults to 2500000.
eventsFunctions.name: SetVideoBitRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the video bit rate to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the audio bit rate per second.  Defaults to 128000 if not set.
eventsFunctions.name: SetAudioBitRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the audio bit rate to _PARAM1_

inlineCode: // Audio recording doesn't work. This function exsits for when it does.

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the audio bit rate per second.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get audio bit rate per second
eventsFunctions.name: AudioBitRate

inlineCode: // Audio recording doesn't work. This function exsits for when it does.

eventsFunctions.description: Set the file format, if a selected file format is unsupported on the users platform a supported one will be picked by deafult.
eventsFunctions.name: SetFormat

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the current video format.
eventsFunctions.name: Format

eventsFunctions.description: Set the video codec, if a selected codec is unsupported on the users platform a supported one will be picked by deafult.
eventsFunctions.name: SetCodec

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the current video codec.
eventsFunctions.name: Codec

eventsFunctions.description: When an error occurs this method will return what type of error it is.
eventsFunctions.name: ErrorType

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an error has occurred.
eventsFunctions.name: OnError

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a recording has just been paused.
eventsFunctions.name: OnPause

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a recording has just been resumed.
eventsFunctions.name: OnResume

eventsFunctions.description: Check if recording has just started.
eventsFunctions.name: OnStart

eventsFunctions.description: Check if recording has just stopped.
eventsFunctions.name: OnStop

eventsFunctions.description: Check if recording has just been saved.
eventsFunctions.name: OnSave

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified format is available on the users device. To avoid unsupported formats pick commons ones like MP4 or WebM.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Is format supported on user device
eventsFunctions.name: IsFormatSupported
eventsFunctions.sentence: Check if _PARAM1_ is available on the users device

parameters.description: Select a common format for the best results
parameters.name: format

eventsFunctions.description: Get the current GIF quality.
eventsFunctions.name: Quality

eventsFunctions.description: Set the GIF quality, must be set before starting a recording. Defaults to 10.
eventsFunctions.name: SetQuality

eventsFunctions.description: Returns whether or not dithering is enabled for GIFs.
eventsFunctions.name: Dithering

eventsFunctions.description: Enable dithering in GIF, must be set before starting a recording. Defaults to false.
eventsFunctions.name: SetDithering
